message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. My initial offer is $18000 for the product. I'm looking forward to hearing your thoughts.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $14000. I believe that's a more reasonable price considering the product's value to me.

I understand your perspective, Bob, but I have to consider the value the product holds for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. My counteroffer is $16000 for the product. I believe it's a fair compromise that benefits both of us.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to go up to $13500. I hope we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're trying to stay within your budget, Bob. However, I've already made a significant concession in the last round. I'm willing to make another compromise, but I need to be closer to my minimum price. My next offer is $16500 for the product. I believe it's a fair price considering the value it holds for me.

I understand that you're trying to get closer to your minimum price, but I'm still trying to stay within my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I need to get closer to my target price. My next offer is $14750. I hope we can find a mutually beneficial agreement.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway again, Bob. However, I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. My next offer is $17000 for the product. I believe it's a fair price considering the value it holds for me.

I understand that you're trying to get closer to your minimum price, but I'm starting to feel like we're getting a bit far apart. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to be realistic about the price. My next offer is $14200. I'm hoping we can meet in the middle and make a deal.

I understand that we're getting close to the end of our negotiation, Bob. I'm willing to make one final concession. However, I need to be realistic about the value of the product and the time we've spent discussing it. My next offer is $17500 for the product. I believe it's a fair price considering the value it holds for me, and I'm willing to compromise on this final offer.

I appreciate your willingness to make one final concession, but I'm afraid I've reached my limit. I'm willing to meet you at $15000, but no higher. If we can't agree on this price, I'll have to consider other options.
